avalancheActivity.highlights: A storm is coming on Thursday with intense rainfall in the mountains that will weaken the snowpack. Next days there will be a SW snowfall in strong winds that could form windslabs in N-A facing hills.

snowpackStructure.highlights: It snowed in E-winds last week and windslabs and cornices have formed in W facing hills. Minor SV snowfall has been falling this week. Warming is expected for the next days with a rainstorm on Thursday that could temporarily destabilize the snowpack. It freezes again on Friday and Saturday that could stabilize the snowpack but a lot of SW snowfall is expected that could form windslabs in N-E facing hills.

travelAdvisory.comment: Thawing weather with intense precipitation went over the country on Thursday and temporarily destabilized the snowpack in all regions. On Friday it freezes again and the snowpack gets more stable but SW snowfall is expected throughout the weekend that could form windslabs into N and E facing hills.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Snowpack is widely considered stable after a freeze-thaw episode on Thursday but SW snowfall during the weekend could cause some instability to form in N and E facing hills.

weatherForecast.highlights: Á fimmtudag gengur yfir hríðarveður í sunnan 30-40 m/sek og slyddu og rigningu til fjalla. Hiti allt að 7 stig en frystir eftir veðrið. Viðvarandi SV snjókoma í miklum vind einkennir föstudag og laugardag.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Considerable snowfall the night to Thursday during temporary E/NE wnd and then rapid warming. Snow can become very unstable.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Rather little snow in the area, mainly in gullies and lows.  Possible older windslabs in SW to NE aspects. A snowprofile was taken in Seljalandsdalur on the 24th. It showed layers of windbroken snow on top of  melt/freez snow. CT showed a fracture by light load at 20 cm and at 26 cm by medium load on the boundary between the windbroken snow and melt/freeze snow. Night to Thursday considerable snowfall in E-NE wind is forecasted and the rapid warming with rain. The snow can become very unstable during the change. Becoming colder with snowshowers during the day and snow can accumulate in northerly aspects.

travelAdvisory.comment: Thawing weather with intense precipitation went over the country on Thursday and temporarily destabilized the snowpack in all regions. On Friday it freezes again and the snowpack gets more stable but SW snowfall is expected throughout the weekend that could form windslabs into N and E facing hills.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Snowpack is widely considered stable after a freeze-thaw episode on Thursday but SW snowfall during the weekend could cause some instability to form in N and E facing hills.

weatherForecast.highlights: Talsverð snjókoma í skammvinnri A/NA-átt aðfaranótt fimmtudags og gegnur í S/SV-átt, hvessir og hlýnar. Kólnar með éljum seinnipartinn. Suðlægar eða breytilegar áttir með éljum á föstudag og laugardag.

avalancheActivity.comment: Avalanches have been falling in the region in various facies. Avalanche was reported from Hrafnabjargarhnjúkur in Karlsárdalur last week that most likely fell on a weak layer boundary between old freeze-thaw snow and a windslab. On Friday, a large slab avalanche of size 2.5 fell in Burstabrekkudalur along with two smaller ones. On Sunday, another small avalanche fell in the same valley.
avalancheActivity.highlights: A storm is coming on Thursday with intense rainfall or wet snow in the mountains that will temporarily weaken the snowpack. Next days there will be a SW snowfall in that could form windslabs in N-A facing hills.

snowpackStructure.highlights: A lot of snow fell last week in N-winds but a lot has also drifted in S-winds after the weekend. NW snowfall also fell on Monday. A weakness can be found in the snowpack on the layer boundary between this new snow and older freeze-thaw snow. Windslabs could be present in various facies on top of this layer boundary. Snowpits have confirmed that this weakness is caused by faceting in the layer boundary and stability tests showed a failure with low to medium load. Rain and warm weather on Thursday could further destabilize the snowpack before it freezes again.

travelAdvisory.comment: Thawing weather with intense precipitation went over the country on Thursday and temporarily destabilized the snowpack in all regions. On Friday it freezes again and the snowpack gets more stable but SW snowfall is expected throughout the weekend that could form windslabs into N and E facing hills.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Snowpack is widely considered stable after a freeze-thaw episode on Thursday but SW snowfall during the weekend could cause some instability to form in N and E facing hills.

weatherForecast.highlights: Á fimmtudag gengur yfir hríðarveður í sunnan 30-40 m/sek. Hlýindi ná upp í fjallstoppa víða og má búast við rigningu eða slyddu til fjalla. Fljótlega frystir eftir veðrið og má búast við lítilsháttar snjókomu á Föstudag og Laugardag í SV áttum.

avalancheActivity.comment: A few sluffs were seen on Sunday. A few slab avalanches occurred in Eskifjörður after the snowfall last week.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Layered windslabs have most likely formed on most aspects. A weak layer of facets has been found between windslabs and the underlying hardpacked snow. Warm weather on Thursday could cause wet avalanches.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Layered windslabs have most likely formed on most aspects. A weak layere of facets has been found between the old hardpacked snow and windslabs. Increasing southerly wind on Wednesday and Thursday with snow likely drifting to northerly aspects. Rising temperature and rain on Thursday could cause wet avalanches.

travelAdvisory.comment: Thawing weather with intense precipitation went over the country on Thursday and temporarily destabilized the snowpack in all regions. On Friday it freezes again and the snowpack gets more stable but SW snowfall is expected throughout the weekend that could form windslabs into N and E facing hills.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Snowpack is widely considered stable after a freeze-thaw episode on Thursday but SW snowfall during the weekend could cause some instability to form in N and E facing hills.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hvessir í S-átt með hlýindum aðfara nótt fimmtudags, rignir um hádegi. Dregur úr úrkomu og kólnar seinnipartinn
